definition: non-Han people, esp. from central Asia/reckless/outrageous/what?/why?/to complete a winning hand at mahjong (also written 和[hu2])
Tang Yulin (1871-1937), minor warlord in northeast China, sometime governor of Chengde 承德, mostly poor in battle but very successful at accumulating personal wealth
Great Sword Society, an offshoot of the White Lotus in the late Qing dynasty, involved in anti-Western activity at the time of the Boxer rebellion
true hero of Greenwood (refers to popular hero in Robin Hood style)
gang of bandits/criminal gang (formerly often used of political opponents)
red bandit (i.e. PLA soldier (during the civil war) or Chinese communist (Tw))
late-Qing underground resistance movement against the Qing dynasty
to send armed forces to suppress
